example.name: rack one's brain
example.text: I racked my brain for hours trying to recall her name.

roleset.name: alternate of wrack-- cause the ruin of

example.name: both args, passive
example.text: Only a few months ago , [the 124 - year - old securities firm]-1 seemed to be on the verge of a meltdown , racked *trace*-1 by internal squabbles and defections .

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on WSJ. Comparison to wrack.

roleset.name: get, acquire

example.name: just transitive
example.text: Toyota's $35,000 Lexus automobile, a luxury model that it started shipping to the U.S. only last month, is racking up orders at a time when U.S.-made luxury-car sales are slow.
example.arg: Toyota's $35,000 Lexus automobile, a luxury model that it started shipping to the U.S. only last month,
at a time when U.S.-made luxury-car sales are slow

roleset.note: Higher args are theoretically possible but unlikely, to my ear.

predicate.note: Frames file for 'rack up' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No Verbnet entry. Comparison with acquire verbs.
